title: Installation issue: Stream (and other codes) with intel@19.1.1.217
body:
There appears to be a problem propagating the correct build environment to the compilers shipped with Intel Parallel Studio 2020 update 1

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->

The same problem occurs for a number of packages including netcdf-fortran and mumps. Stream is simply the fastest and simplest reproducer.

```console
$ spack install stream%intel@19.1.1.217
2 errors found in build log: 
     35    f77 -O2 -c stream.f
     36    f77 -O2 stream.o mysecond.o -o stream_f.exe
  >> 37    ld: /dcsrsoft/spack/external/intel/2020u1/compilers_and_libraries_2020.1.217/linux/bin/intel64/../../lib/LLVMgold.so: error loading plugin: libimf.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
  >> 38    make: *** [stream_f.exe] Error 1
```

The build works correctly with Intel@19.1.0.166 and also with a dirty build environment

```
$ spack install stream%intel@19.1.0.166
..
..
==> 172171: stream: Executing phase: 'edit'
==> 172171: stream: Executing phase: 'build'
==> 172171: stream: Executing phase: 'install'
==> 172171: stream: Successfully installed stre
```

```
$  spack load intel@19.1.1.217

$ spack install --dirty stream%intel@19.1.1.217
..
..
==> 172490: stream: Building stream [MakefilePackage]
==> 172490: stream: Executing phase: 'edit'
==> 172490: stream: Executing phase: 'build'
==> 172490: stream: Executing phase: 'install'
==> 172490: stream: Successfully installed stream
  Fetch: 0.03s.  Build: 1.02s.  Total: 1.06s.
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.13.3-2728-294ee67
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
```

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

Adding the path to libimf in the icc.cfg doesn't help and it's not at all clear what has changed between the initial release of 2020 and update 1.
